question: To organise file systems on disk _______________
options: ['a) they are split into one or more partitions', 'b) information about files is added to each partition', 'c) they are made on different storage spaces', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) they are split into one or more partitions
option2: b) information about files is added to each partition
option3: c) they are made on different storage spaces

question: The directory can be viewed as a _________ that translates file names into their directory entries
options: ['a) symbol table', 'b) partition', 'c) swap space', 'd) cache']

question: What will happen in the single level directory?
options: ['a) All files are contained in different directories all at the same level', 'b) All files are contained in the same directory', 'c) Depends on the operating system', 'd) None of the mentioned']
option1: a) All files are contained in different directories all at the same level
option2: b) All files are contained in the same directory
option3: c) Depends on the operating system

question: What will happen in the single level directory?
options: ['a) all directories must have unique names', 'b) all files must have unique names', 'c) all files must have unique owners', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) all directories must have unique names
option2: b) all files must have unique names
option3: c) all files must have unique owners

question: What will happen in the two level directory structure?
options: ['a) each user has his/her own user file directory', 'b) the system doesn’t its own master file directory', 'c) all of the mentioned', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) each user has his/her own user file directory
option2: b) the system doesn’t its own master file directory

question: When a user job starts in a two level directory system, or a user logs in _____________
options: ['a) the users user file directory is searched', 'b) the system’s master file directory is not searched', 'c) the master file directory is indexed by user name or account number, and each entry points to the UFD for that user', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) the users user file directory is searched
option2: b) the system’s master file directory is not searched
option3: c) the master file directory is indexed by user name or account number, and each entry points to the UFD for that user

question: When a user refers to a particular file?
options: ['a) system MFD is searched', 'b) his own UFD is not searched', 'c) both MFD and UFD are searched', 'd) every directory is searched']
option2: b) his own UFD is not searched
option3: c) both MFD and UFD are searched

question: What is the disadvantage of the two level directory structure?
options: ['a) it does not solve the name collision problem', 'b) it solves the name collision problem', 'c) it does not isolate users from one another', 'd) it isolates users from one another']
option1: a) it does not solve the name collision problem
option2: b) it solves the name collision problem
option3: c) it does not isolate users from one another
option4: d) it isolates users from one another

question: In the tree structured directories _____________
options: ['a) the tree has the stem directory', 'b) the tree has the leaf directory', 'c) the tree has the root directory', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) the tree has the stem directory
option2: b) the tree has the leaf directory
option3: c) the tree has the root directory

question: The current directory contains, most of the files that are _____________
options: ['a) of current interest to the user', 'b) stored currently in the system', 'c) not used in the system', 'd) not of current interest to the system']
option1: a) of current interest to the user
option2: b) stored currently in the system
option3: c) not used in the system
option4: d) not of current interest to the system

question: Which of the following are the types of Path names?
options: ['a) absolute & relative', 'b) local & global', 'c) global & relative', 'd) relative & local']
